body: Is remote device no longer an introducer? Or SkipIntroductionRemovals is enabled somewhere?
Also, did the devices reconnect since introducer removed the old device?

> Is remote device no longer an introducer? Or SkipIntroductionRemovals is enabled somewhere?

Remote device is not an introducer. I never used the advanced parameter 'skip introducter removals".

> Also, did the devices reconnect since introducer removed the old device?

Yes, they are always connected.
Well the web gui thinks it's an introducer. Can you provide longs and screenshots of the remote device settings on local device (the one that you can't remove the device from).
This seems to be fixed in Syncthing v1.2.0 (installed on Arch here), but the bug is still present in vv1.0.0-ds1 (Debian Buster), so maybe this issue can be closed?
I don't think there was anything related to this that could have fixed it.
The bug is still occuring in v1.3.3 for me. @AudriusButkevicius

I have experienced the same issue.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/74789840-39e71000-52f9-11ea-9974-622d49b72eee.png)

This happens on all my devices, where the same device was originally set (and still is) as an introducer. It is impossible to remove any devices introduced by it, even though they have been long removed from the introducer itself.

The workaround is to temporarily set the original introducer to non-introducer, remove the problematic devices, and then set it to introducer again.

This still happens for me in 1.6.1.
I have a device removed from the introducer which I now can't remove from other devices.

I try to ignore these things, but since this is the multiple-th time today and multiple times in this same thread: open issues in the tracker are *known issues*. We know it still happens in the latest release, that's why the issue is here and is open. So there is no need to reiterate that fact. A better contribution is a patch to fix it.

Suggestion:

* To fix this issue:
  * don't disable the "Remove" button if the device has been introduced.
  * adapt the tooltip to "{{ willBeReintroducedBy }} might reintroduce this device."

* In a new feature request issue, suggest:
  * to disable the removal button iff the introducer:
    * still has the device &&
    * is currently connected

AFAIU, disabling the "Remove" is a useful UI feature if it works. If it doesn't, like presently, it does more harm than good.

Since this is small change, I created a PR in case you think this makes sense: https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/pull/7216

issue.title: gui: Allow device removal even if possibly reintroduced (fixes #5426)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

milestone.title: v1.14.0
milestone.description:
This release adds configurable device and folder defaults.

The output format of the [/rest/db/browse endpoint](https://docs.syncthing.net/rest/db-browse-get.html) has changed.

issue.body:
### Purpose

Fixes #5426 according to https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/5426#issuecomment-748635865

Not approved yet, but since the PR is small enough, I went ahead in case you think it makes sense.

### Testing

Not tested yet.
